meanings.definition: The force exerted on a surface by the weight of the air above it.
meanings.sent1: The preassures from the heavy air made the windows rattle.
meanings.sent2: The preassures of the atmosphere can affect weather patterns.
meanings.sent3: The preassures of the air seemed to play a game of push and pull with the roof.
meanings.sent4: The preassures of the sky seemed to press down on the valley below.
meanings.sent5: The preassures of the air felt like a giant invisible hand pressing on everything below.

meanings.definition: The feeling of stress or urgency caused by a demanding situation.
meanings.sent1: She felt the preassures of the upcoming exam weighing on her.
meanings.sent2: The preassures of work deadlines can be overwhelming at times.
meanings.sent3: The preassures of the situation made her want to laugh and cry at the same time.
meanings.sent4: The preassures of the moment felt like a heavy weight on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The preassures of the deadline loomed over her like a dark cloud.

meanings.definition: To apply force or influence on someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: He preassures his teammates to perform better in the game.
meanings.sent2: The coach preassures the players to give their best effort.
meanings.sent3: She preassures him gently to try the new food.
meanings.sent4: The salesman preassures the customer to make a quick decision.
meanings.sent5: The teacher preassures the students to complete their assignments on time.
